hotspots.label: Scorpion Head
hotspots.fact: A scorpion's head contains two large eyes on top and smaller eyes on the sides to help it hunt at night. These eyes work together to detect movement of prey in dark places.

hotspots.label: Segmented Body
hotspots.fact: A scorpion's body is divided into 12 segments that work like rings of armor to protect its soft insides. This flexible design allows the scorpion to curl up and move in tight spaces.

hotspots.label: Curved Tail with Stinger
hotspots.fact: The scorpion's curved tail is called the metasoma and contains venom in a stinger at the tip. Scorpions use their tails to catch and paralyze prey much larger than their heads!

hotspots.label: Legs and Pedipalps
hotspots.fact: Scorpions have 8 walking legs plus two special front appendages called pedipalps that look like claws. They use their pedipalps to grab and hold onto food while eating.
